channel.title: Baccano! 1930's Prohibition mafia anime of excellence
channel.description:
Go to [url]https://www.hulu.com[/url] and register if you haven't already.
Search for Baccano. Season 1 Episode 1. The entire first season is available free online, but only until Oct 30. It's a 16 episode 24-minute long format that is filled to the brim with great moments.
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Msg8ypnLqaw]Opening[/url]
You know how there are some animes where you just stand around looking at scenery? Yeah, Baccano doesn't really do that except when it comes to violence. It's actually pretty brutal and is rated M for Mature audiences. But it's also mature in the sense of telling a very elaborate story through the viewpoints of an ensemble cast that represents a wide spectrum of interesting and intelligent characters.
[img]https://danbooru.donmai.us/data/45bc68e147f4082a4e0063c9732a8fcc.gif[/img]

item.title: Baccano! 1930's Prohibition mafia anime of excellence
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
The show is fairly awesome.

Like, really cool. I legit laughed at points, so I guess it’s not bad at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Baccano! 1930's Prohibition mafia anime of excellence
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
He didn’t say it was bad. He simply said ‘Fuck Hulu’, and he said it because he can’t easily use it, which would make it a bad service in his eyes.

it would be akin to me saying ‘To Hell Angelina Jolie. She won’t have sex with me.’ Doesn’t mean the sex is bad, but I’m saying to hell with her, because I can’t tap 'dat ass.

Read full topic
item.source: Baccano! 1930's Prohibition mafia anime of excellence

item.title: Baccano! 1930's Prohibition mafia anime of excellence
item.dc:creator: The_Wandering_God
item.description:
Winged One:

Anyway, I might watch this. It’s kinda hard to peg it for violence, though. The intro seems pretty light-hearted.

I mean, are we talking Elfen Lied violence or more slapstick violence?

In the first episode, someone is shot directly in the head making for a mess. You see someone grip a knife and when the knife’s pulled back, a couple of fingers come off as well.

I never saw Elfen Lied, but after using this random AMV video as a reference, I have to say that Baccano isn’t quite that violent. But it does come close on a fairly regular basis.

Imonfire:

Do you seriously want to go there?

I was merely parodying your statement by saying something is bad b/c I don’t have access to it while others do. I myself support socialized health care and feel that America not having it is a tragedy.

Read full topic
item.source: Baccano! 1930's Prohibition mafia anime of excellence

item.title: Baccano! 1930's Prohibition mafia anime of excellence
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
I love the characters’ “American” names on this series - they all look like randomly generated spam Captcha text.

I’ll bet 1930’s America was simply overflowing with people named “Jacuzzi Splot” and “Szilard Quates.”

Read full topic

item.title: Baccano! 1930's Prohibition mafia anime of excellence
item.dc:creator: The_Wandering_God
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

Why would the Japanese care about 1930s America? Weren’t they busy with the yakuza when that shit was going on?

Yeah, that’s like Hollywood making a movie about the history of another country.

Especially a time period that featured such things as violence, intrigue, betryal, and multiple allies and enemies.

And then just started adding stuff until it was busting at the seems with top quality entertainment.

Read full topic
